edu.umn.ncs
[Groovy] Class PersonContact

java.lang.Object
  PersonContact
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
class PersonContact

This domain class is not used directly, it is inherited by other classes. This base class provides the base functionality needed to track contact relationships from a person to some other kind of entity.

Property Summary
java.lang.String appCreated

This field should be assigned the name of the application that is creating an instance of this class.
static java.lang.Object belongsTo

This static belongsTo map ties this class to a edu.umn.ncs.Person object via the 'person' attribute.
static java.lang.Object constraints

This contains any constraints for this domain class.

java.util.Date dateCreated

This field is automatically assigned the date that this particular ContactRole instance was created
java.util.Date endDate

This is teh last date that this contact point is active.

int endDay

If this is a seasonal contact point, this is the day of month of the year that this contact point ceases to be valid.

int endMonth

If this is a seasonal contact point, this is the month of the year that this contact point ceases to be valid.

static java.lang.Object hasMany

This static hasMany map links this contact point to a collection of edu.umn.ncs.CommentPersonContact objects via the 'comments' attribute.
java.util.Date infoDate

This is the date that you were informed of this contact point.
Source infoSource

This is the source of information that provided you the information regarding this contact point.
java.util.Date lastUpdated

This field should be propogated with the current date and time "new Date()" that an instance of this class is updated.

static java.lang.Object mapping

This sets the default sort order for this class to be 'preferredOrder'.
boolean okToUse

This flag tells us if it's OK to use this contact point.

int preferredOrder

This is the preferred order of the contact point.

Person proxyContact

This optional field is used if this contact point is through a proxy person, in other words, the contact point belongs to someone else, not the person whom the contact is tied to, then assign a proxyContact of the proxy edu.umn.ncs.Person here.

java.util.Date startDate

This is the date that this contact point becomes active.

int startDay

If this is a seasonal contact point, this is the day of month of the year that this contact point starts to be valid.

int startMonth

If this is a seasonal contact point, this is the month of the year that this contact point starts to be valid.

static java.lang.Object transients

The following transients are documents in their respective get*() functions.
java.lang.String userCreated

This field should be assigned the username of the authenticated user that is creating an instance of this class.
java.lang.String userUpdated

This field should be propogated with the username of the authenticated user when an instance of this class is updated.

See if this conact point is a "snow bird" address, phone, email, etc...

This is a helper function to mark this contact point as inactive as of today.

Property Detail

appCreated

java.lang.String appCreated
This field should be assigned the name of the application that is creating an instance of this class.

belongsTo

static java.lang.Object belongsTo
This static belongsTo map ties this class to a edu.umn.ncs.Person object via the 'person' attribute.

constraints

static java.lang.Object constraints
This contains any constraints for this domain class. Non-default constraints for this class are
  • proxyContactID is nullable (optional)
  • endDate is nullable (optional)
  • lastUpdated is nullable (optional)
  • userUpaded is nullable (optional)
  • infoDate is nullable (optional)
  • infoSource is nullable (optional)
  • startMonth is restricted to the range 0-12
  • startDay is restricted to the range 1-31
  • endMonth is restricted to the range 0-12
  • endDay is restricted to the range 1-31

dateCreated

java.util.Date dateCreated
This field is automatically assigned the date that this particular ContactRole instance was created

endDate

java.util.Date endDate
This is teh last date that this contact point is active. This is useful if someone tells you that they are moving on a certain date, or they will no longer have a certain phone number on a particular date

endDay

int endDay
If this is a seasonal contact point, this is the day of month of the year that this contact point ceases to be valid. These are common with "snow bird" phone numbers and addresses. This field defaults to the value 31.

endMonth

int endMonth
If this is a seasonal contact point, this is the month of the year that this contact point ceases to be valid. These are common with "snow bird" phone numbers and addresses. This field defaults to the value 0, which makes it inactive.

hasMany

static java.lang.Object hasMany
This static hasMany map links this contact point to a collection of edu.umn.ncs.CommentPersonContact objects via the 'comments' attribute.

infoDate

java.util.Date infoDate
This is the date that you were informed of this contact point.

infoSource

Source infoSource
This is the source of information that provided you the information regarding this contact point.

lastUpdated

java.util.Date lastUpdated
This field should be propogated with the current date and time "new Date()" that an instance of this class is updated. Grails will automatically take care of this per section 5.5.1 of the Grails 1.3.7 documentation.

mapping

static java.lang.Object mapping
This sets the default sort order for this class to be 'preferredOrder'.

okToUse

boolean okToUse
This flag tells us if it's OK to use this contact point. For example, sometimes someone will notify us of an address, such as a cabin, but they don't want us to send mail to them there.

preferredOrder

int preferredOrder
This is the preferred order of the contact point. If order is = 1 for a particular contact type, then it is the preffered contact point.

proxyContact

Person proxyContact
This optional field is used if this contact point is through a proxy person, in other words, the contact point belongs to someone else, not the person whom the contact is tied to, then assign a proxyContact of the proxy edu.umn.ncs.Person here. Examples of this usage are "in care of", sometimes noted as "% Some Person"

startDate

java.util.Date startDate
This is the date that this contact point becomes active. By default, this date is today.

startDay

int startDay
If this is a seasonal contact point, this is the day of month of the year that this contact point starts to be valid. These are common with "snow bird" phone numbers and addresses. This field defaults to the value 1.

startMonth

int startMonth
If this is a seasonal contact point, this is the month of the year that this contact point starts to be valid. These are common with "snow bird" phone numbers and addresses. This field defaults to the value 0, which makes it inactive.

transients

static java.lang.Object transients
The following transients are documents in their respective get*() functions.

userCreated

java.lang.String userCreated
This field should be assigned the username of the authenticated user that is creating an instance of this class.

userUpdated

java.lang.String userUpdated
This field should be propogated with the username of the authenticated user when an instance of this class is updated.

 
Constructor Detail

PersonContact

PersonContact()

 
Method Detail

getContactCategory

java.lang.String getContactCategory()
This returns the category of this contact point based on what some of the helper functions. This is used primarily for display purposes. Possible values it can return are:
  • Seasonal
  • Do Not Use
  • Inactive
  • blank

getContactClass

java.lang.String getContactClass()
This returns the classification of the contact point based on what some of the helper functions. Possible values it can return are:
  • seasonal
  • seasonal-inactive
  • do-not-use
  • inactive
  • blank

getContactType

java.lang.String getContactType()
This function just removes some of the basic class name information, leaving the name of the contact type. It just removes the string "class edu.umn.ncs.Person" from the class name, and returns that.

isActive

boolean isActive()
This functions checks to see if this contact point is active/valid today.

isSeasonal

boolean isSeasonal()
See if this conact point is a "snow bird" address, phone, email, etc...

isSeasonalActive

boolean isSeasonalActive()
This checks to see if this seasonal contact point is in it's "active" window

terminate

void terminate()
This is a helper function to mark this contact point as inactive as of today.
